verses.kjv: But king Solomon loved many strange women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites;
verses.web: Now king Solomon loved many foreign women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites;
verses.ct: King Solomon loved many foreign women — not only Pharaoh's daughter, but also women from the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites.

verses.kjv: Of the nations concerning which the LORD said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in unto you: for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon clave unto these in love.
verses.web: of the nations concerning which LORD said to the children of Israel, “You shall not go among them, neither shall they come among you; for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods.” Solomon joined to these in love.
verses.ct: These were from the very nations the LORD had warned Israel about: "Don't intermarry with them, and don't let them intermarry with you, because they will surely turn your hearts toward their gods." Yet Solomon held on to these women in love.

verses.kjv: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.
verses.web: He had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines. His wives turned his heart away.
verses.ct: He had 700 wives of royal birth and 300 concubines, and his wives pulled his heart away from God.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as was the heart of David his father.
verses.web: When Solomon was old, his wives turned away his heart after other gods; and his heart was not perfect with LORD his God, as the heart of David his father was.
verses.ct: As Solomon grew old, his wives turned his heart toward other gods. His heart was no longer fully devoted to the LORD his God the way his father David's heart had been.

verses.kjv: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
verses.web: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
verses.ct: Solomon followed Ashtoreth, the goddess of the Zidonians, and Milcom, the detestable god of the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And Solomon did evil in the sight of the LORD, and went not fully after the LORD, as did David his father.
verses.web: Solomon did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, and didn’t go fully after LORD, as David his father did.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that Solomon was evil. Unlike his father David, he did not follow the LORD wholeheartedly.

verses.kjv: Then did Solomon build an high place for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, in the hill that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech, the abomination of the children of Ammon.
verses.web: Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, on the mountain that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech the abomination of the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: Solomon even built a worship site on the hill east of Jerusalem for Chemosh, the detestable god of Moab, and for Molech, the detestable god of the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And likewise did he for all his strange wives, which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods.
verses.web: So he did for all his foreign wives, who burned incense and sacrificed to their gods.
verses.ct: He did the same for all his foreign wives, letting them burn incense and offer sacrifices to their gods.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned from the LORD God of Israel, which had appeared unto him twice,
verses.web: LORD was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned away from LORD, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice,
verses.ct: The LORD was angry with Solomon because his heart had turned away from the LORD, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice

verses.kjv: And had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which the LORD commanded.
verses.web: and had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods; but he didn’t keep that which LORD commanded.
verses.ct: and had specifically commanded him not to follow other gods. But Solomon refused to obey what the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the LORD said unto Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant.
verses.web: Therefore LORD said to Solomon, “Because this is done by you, and you have not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded you, I will surely tear the kingdom from you, and will give it to your servant.
verses.ct: So the LORD told Solomon, "Because you have done this and have not kept my covenant and the commands I gave you, I will certainly tear the kingdom away from you and give it to one of your servants.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it for David thy father’s sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
verses.web: Nevertheless, I will not do it in your days, for David your father’s sake; but I will tear it out of your son’s hand.
verses.ct: However, I won't do it during your lifetime, for the sake of your father David. I will tear it from your son's hand instead.

verses.kjv: Howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen.
verses.web: However I will not tear away all the kingdom; but I will give one tribe to your son, for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen.”
verses.ct: Even then, I won't tear away the entire kingdom. I will leave your son one tribe — for the sake of my servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city I have chosen."

verses.kjv: And the LORD stirred up an adversary unto Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king’s seed in Edom.
verses.web: LORD raised up an adversary to Solomon: Hadad the Edomite. He was one of the king’s offspring in Edom.
verses.ct: Then the LORD raised up an adversary against Solomon — Hadad the Edomite, who was from the royal family of Edom.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom;
verses.web: For when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the army had gone up to bury the slain, and had struck every male in Edom
verses.ct: Earlier, when David was in Edom and Joab, the army commander, had gone to bury the dead after striking down every male in Edom —

verses.kjv: (For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel, until he had cut off every male in Edom:)
verses.web: (for Joab and all Israel remained there six months, until he had cut off every male in Edom);
verses.ct: (Joab and all Israel had stayed there 6 months until they had killed every male in Edom) —

verses.kjv: That Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt; Hadad being yet a little child.
verses.web: Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt, when Hadad was still a little child.
verses.ct: Hadad had escaped. He was still a young boy at the time, and he fled toward Egypt along with some of his father's Edomite servants.

verses.kjv: And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran: and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, unto Pharaoh king of Egypt; which gave him an house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land.
verses.web: They arose out of Midian, and came to Paran; and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house, and appointed him food, and gave him land.
verses.ct: They left Midian and traveled to Paran, where they gathered more men. Then they continued on to Egypt and came before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who gave Hadad a house, provided him with food, and granted him land.

verses.kjv: And Hadad found great favour in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
verses.web: Hadad found great favor in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him as wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
verses.ct: Hadad won such favor with Pharaoh that Pharaoh gave him his own wife's sister — the sister of Queen Tahpenes — as his wife.

verses.kjv: And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among the sons of Pharaoh.
verses.web: The sister of Tahpenes bore him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house; and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s house among the sons of Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Tahpenes' sister gave birth to his son Genubath, and Tahpenes raised the boy in Pharaoh's palace. Genubath grew up there among Pharaoh's own sons.

verses.kjv: And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to mine own country.
verses.web: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the army was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, “Let me depart, that I may go to my own country.”
verses.ct: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David had died and that Joab the army commander was also dead, he said to Pharaoh, "Let me leave so I can return to my own country."

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing: howbeit let me go in any wise.
verses.web: Then Pharaoh said to him, “But what have you lacked with me, that behold, you seek to go to your own country?” He answered, “Nothing, however only let me depart.”
verses.ct: Pharaoh asked him, "What have you lacked here with me that you want to go back to your own country?" Hadad replied, "Nothing — but please, let me go."

verses.kjv: And God stirred him up another adversary, Rezon the son of Eliadah, which fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah:
verses.web: God raised up an adversary to him, Rezon the son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah.
verses.ct: God also raised up another adversary against Solomon — Rezon son of Eliadah, who had fled from his master Hadadezer, king of Zobah.

verses.kjv: And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus.
verses.web: He gathered men to himself, and became captain over a troop, when David killed them of Zobah. They went to Damascus, and lived there, and reigned in Damascus.
verses.ct: After David defeated the forces of Zobah, Rezon gathered a band of men around him and became their leader. They went to Damascus, settled there, and Rezon ruled in Damascus.

verses.kjv: And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, beside the mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
verses.web: He was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, in addition to the mischief of Hadad. He abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
verses.ct: Rezon was an enemy of Israel throughout Solomon's reign, adding to the trouble Hadad caused. He despised Israel and ruled over Syria.

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon’s servant, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against the king.
verses.web: Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite of Zeredah, a servant of Solomon, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow, also lifted up his hand against the king.
verses.ct: Then there was Jeroboam son of Nebat, an Ephrathite from Zereda. His mother was a widow named Zeruah. He was one of Solomon's officials, and he too rebelled against the king.

verses.kjv: And this was the cause that he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breaches of the city of David his father.
verses.web: This was the reason why he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breach of his father David’s city.
verses.ct: Here's why he rebelled: Solomon had built the Millo and repaired the gaps in the wall of his father David's city.

verses.kjv: And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valour: and Solomon seeing the young man that he was industrious, he made him ruler over all the charge of the house of Joseph.
verses.web: The man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor; and Solomon saw the young man that he was industrious, and he put him in charge of all the labor of the house of Joseph.
verses.ct: Jeroboam was a capable and energetic man. When Solomon noticed how hard the young man worked, he put him in charge of all the labor force from the tribes of Joseph.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field:
verses.web: At that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him on the way. Now Ahijah had clad himself with a new garment; and the two of them were alone in the field.
verses.ct: Around that time, Jeroboam left Jerusalem, and the prophet Ahijah from Shiloh met him on the road. Ahijah was wearing a new cloak, and the two of them were alone out in the open countryside.

verses.kjv: And Ahijah caught the new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces:
verses.web: Ahijah took the new garment that was on him, and tore it in twelve pieces.
verses.ct: Ahijah grabbed the new cloak he was wearing and tore it into 12 pieces.

verses.kjv: And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces: for thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee:
verses.web: He said to Jeroboam, “Take ten pieces; for LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to you
verses.ct: Then he told Jeroboam, "Take 10 pieces for yourself, because this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I am about to tear the kingdom out of Solomon's hand and give 10 tribes to you.

verses.kjv: (But he shall have one tribe for my servant David’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel:)
verses.web: (but he shall have one tribe, for my servant David’s sake and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel);
verses.ct: But Solomon will keep one tribe, for the sake of my servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city I chose from among all the tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv: Because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon, and have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in mine eyes, and to keep my statutes and my judgments, as did David his father.
verses.web: because that they have forsaken me, and have worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of Moab, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon. They have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in my eyes, and to keep my statutes and my ordinances, as David his father did.
verses.ct: I am doing this because they have abandoned me and worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the Ammonites. They have not walked in my ways or done what is right in my eyes, and they have not kept my statutes and laws the way David his father did.

verses.kjv: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant’s sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:
verses.web: “ ‘However I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand; but I will make him prince all the days of his life, for David my servant’s sake whom I chose, who kept my commandments and my statutes;
verses.ct: Still, I will not take the whole kingdom from Solomon himself. I will let him be ruler for the rest of his life, for the sake of my servant David, whom I chose because he kept my commandments and statutes.

verses.kjv: But I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it unto thee, even ten tribes.
verses.web: but I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it to you, even ten tribes.
verses.ct: But I will take the kingdom from his son's hand and give 10 tribes to you.

verses.kjv: And unto his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a light alway before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen me to put my name there.
verses.web: I will give one tribe to his son, that David my servant may have a lamp always before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen for myself to put my name there.
verses.ct: I will give his son one tribe, so that my servant David will always have a lamp burning before me in Jerusalem, the city I chose as the place for my name.

verses.kjv: And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.
verses.web: I will take you, and you shall reign according to all that your soul desires, and shall be king over Israel.
verses.ct: As for you, I will take you, and you will rule over everything your heart desires. You will be king over Israel.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that is right in my sight, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel unto thee.
verses.web: It shall be, if you will listen to all that I command you, and will walk in my ways, and do that which is right in my eyes, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with you, and will build you a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel to you.
verses.ct: If you listen to everything I command you, walk in my ways, and do what is right in my eyes by keeping my statutes and commandments as my servant David did, then I will be with you. I will build you a lasting dynasty, just as I built one for David, and I will give Israel to you.

verses.kjv: And I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not for ever.
verses.web: I will afflict the offspring of David for this, but not forever.’ ”
verses.ct: Because of all this, I will humble David's descendants — but not forever.'"

verses.kjv: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, unto Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
verses.web: Therefore Solomon sought to kill Jeroboam; but Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
verses.ct: Solomon tried to kill Jeroboam, but Jeroboam fled to Egypt and found refuge with King Shishak. He stayed in Egypt until Solomon died.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, aren’t they written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
verses.ct: Everything else about Solomon's reign — all he accomplished and the wisdom he displayed — is recorded in the book of the acts of Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
verses.web: The time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
verses.ct: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in his father David’s city; and Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Then Solomon died and was buried in the city of his father David. His son Rehoboam became king after him.
